item.description:
Last play of the season...

The Players’ Ring ENDS its 20th season with:


Timon of Athens

by William Shakespeare  ~~~ Directed by Glenn Provost

WARNING: This production contains violence, nudity, and a sequence involving strobe-light effects.** (Woo Hoo!)

No one under the age of 18 will be admitted without parental consent.

"Misfortune shows those who are not really friends." – Aristotle

Timon is the very picture of generosity and good will, but by giving to the ungrateful senators and merchants of Athens, she seals her own fate. Driven to madness by their inevitable ingratitude and cast into the wilderness, Timon slowly resigns herself to death. However, her friendship with an equally wronged and avenging general is the only thing that can save the city, calling the senators of Athens back to her even as she wastes away in exile…

Drawing on timely themes of inequality and greed, Timon of Athens presents the story of a time and people out of balance. Incorporating a lavish set, sound and costume design that transport the viewer to an unnamed yet recognizable time and place, this show is the crowning production of the Players’ Ring’s 20th Mainstage Season.   Don't miss it.

Tickets: Only $12 each with the Seacoast Outdoors discount!

Arrive @ the theater 7:30, show begins @ 8pm.

Reserve by phone at 603/ 436*8123 and say you're with Seacoast Outdoors Meetup to receive a discount. Then pay at the door. Or, buy tickets online.  These shows do sell out so make sure you reserve!

** If you have photosensitive epilepsy or are otherwise affected by strobe lights, please do not attend this production without making special arrangements with the theater beforehand.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Ri~Ra Irish Pub - Meet @ 6pm for drinks/dinner.

...let me know if you're coming so I can reserve a table.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


The Players' Ring Theater -  Since 1992, the mission of The Players' Ring has been to promote the efforts of local artists through the production of original works, while providing an affordable theatre space to local production companies. “The Ring” as we know and love it, nurtures all artists and provides an environment where artists can thrive, grow, take risks and make daring choices. The Players' Ring is located in a nineteenth century brick building on Marcy Street on the grounds of Prescott Park in Portsmouth, New Hampshire. The historic building is owned by the City of Portsmouth and is fitted out as a “black box” theatre. With a seating capacity of 75, The Players' Ring annual attendance is approximately 6,500. Since its creation, more than 30 local production companies have presented plays at The Players' Ring. While some form to produce a single special event, some production companies produce shows on an annual basis. Over 200 actors, directors, playwrights and technicians work together to produce plays at The Players' Ring each year. Over the past five years, over $180,000 has been distributed to those involved in Players' Ring productions. Original works account for half of each season’s offerings.

Liability Release - AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer and his heirs, and all members and participants of the Seacoast Outdoors Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Participation in this activity is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.

*Unless otherwise specified, refunds for timely cancellations will be processed the day after the event.

*Time and location are subject to change due to weather and other factors.  Always check email & this listing for updates before leaving home.
item.name: Timon of Athens @ The Players' Ring
